paragraphs.title: PRODUCT OVERVIEW
paragraphs.text:
%angular

Introduction

SnappyData (aka TIBCO ComputeDB ™ community edition) is a distributed, in-memory optimized analytics database. SnappyData delivers high throughput, low latency, and high concurrency for unified analytics workload. By fusing an in-memory hybrid database inside Apache Spark, it provides analytic query processing, mutability/transactions, access to virtually all big data sources and stream processing all in one unified cluster. Read more about TIBCO ComputeDB (enterprise edition) and Snappydata Project (open source edition).

msg.data:
Introduction

SnappyData (aka TIBCO ComputeDB ™ community edition) is a distributed, in-memory optimized analytics database. SnappyData delivers high throughput, low latency, and high concurrency for unified analytics workload. By fusing an in-memory hybrid database inside Apache Spark, it provides analytic query processing, mutability/transactions, access to virtually all big data sources and stream processing all in one unified cluster. Read more about TIBCO ComputeDB (enterprise edition) and Snappydata Project (open source edition).

Demos

Objectives

The Quickstart notebook runs you through short examples on how to get started with the product quickly.

  • Creating Snappy Session
  • Using sparks scala apis
  • Defining schema and creating SQL tables
  • Creating and inserting Dataset into Data Tables
  • Using SnappyData Shell
  • Using Java Application (JDBC) to connect to SnappyData cluster

Objectives

This performance benchmark notebook showcases the performance of the product over Apache Spark 2.1.1 using a locally generated dataset.

Objectives

This performance benchmark notebook showcases the performance of the product over Apache Spark 2.1.1 using a dataset hosted on Amazon S3.

Objectives

  1. NYC taxi analytics notebook uses the AQP engine.
  2. Execute the query on the exact data noting the time it takes to parse parquet data and execute the query using Spark parallel processing (LEFT PARAGRAPHS)
  3. Execute the same query using Synopses data engine noting both the accuracy and response time of the answer. (RIGHT PARAGRAPHS)
  4. We illustrate various features: constraining the error in query responses, Automatically swapping the approximate visualized plot with an exact response, projecting error rates as part of the query response and automatic query re-routing to underlying data source when error constraints cannot be satisfied.

Objective

  • Airline online analytics notebook uses the AQP engine.
  • The U.S. Department of Transportation's (DOT) Bureau of Transportation Statistics (BTS) tracks the on-time performance of domestic flights operated by large air carriers.
  • Summary information on the number of on-time, delayed, canceled and diverted flights is available for the last 20 years.
  • In this demo we used the 2009-2015 data set (40 million records) and show simple analytic queries on "exact" as well as "sampled" data.You will be able to compare the response times and be able to inspect the accuracy differences.
You can always share your thoughts/questions via slack, Gitter, stackoverflow , google groups or encourage us at http://www.snappydata.io/community
